result.execSummary:
All charges against Jerome D Ward in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerome D Ward is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:53 PM 
Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jerome D Ward in court, in custody at Milwaukee County Jail by zoom, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Kay requests a short amount of time to review the Competency report with his client.
Court grants.
Attorney Kay requests that the Court modify the Cash Bail to a Signature Bond.
State objects.
Court will MODIFY the Cash Bail from $2,500.00 to $500.00 with the same conditions.

Case called at 1:39 PM 
Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jerome D Ward in court, in custody at Mendota, with attorney Timothy T. Kay as friend of the Court.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Court will quash the warrant.
Attorney Kay will work on getting appointed to this new case.
Attorney Kay requests a preliminary hearing but will waive the time limits.
Attorney Kay requests that a competency examination be done under Section 971.14(2), Wisconsin Statutes.
